name: TriggerBuild
description: This tasks allows to trigger a new Build (add it to the queue) as part of a Build Definition. It contains as well some conditions that can be applied, for example if the last build of certain definition was successful or not.
author: Benjamin Huser

inputs.name: definitionIsInCurrentTeamProject
inputs.label: True if the build to be triggered is defined within the same team project as this build
inputs.helpMarkDown: If set to false, Team Project and Collection URL to use must be entered manually. This is needed if you want to point to a different server, collection or team project on the same server.

inputs.name: tfsServer
inputs.label: URL to TFS Server (including Collection)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The server the build you want to trigger is located including the collection and team project.  Example: https://myVSTSAccount.visualstudio.com/DefaultCollection or https://www.myOnPremTfs.com/MyCollection

inputs.name: teamProject
inputs.label: Team Project
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Team Project the build you want to trigger is in. This can be display name of the project or its id

inputs.name: buildDefinition
inputs.label: Name or ID of the Build Definitions that shall be triggered
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-Separated list of names/ids of the definitions that a new build should be queued for.

inputs.name: queueBuildForUserThatTriggeredBuild
inputs.label: Queue Build for user that triggered original build
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this option is enabled, the triggered build will run for the same user that triggered the original build. Otherwise the triggered user depends on the means of authentication. Please refer to the (documentation)[https://github.com/huserben/TfsExtensions/blob/master/BuildTasks/overview.md#basic-configuration].

inputs.name: ignoreSslCertificateErrors
inputs.label: Ignore SSL Certificate Errors
inputs.helpMarkDown: When enabled possible certificate errors (for example untrusted CA's) will be ignored

inputs.name: useSameSourceVersion
inputs.label: Use current source version for the triggered build
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this option is enabled, the triggered build will run with the same source version as the original build. Source Versions are either changesets or labels. If this is not enabled, the newest version will be used.

inputs.name: useCustomSourceVersion
inputs.label: Use a custom source version for the triggered build
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this option is enabled, the triggered build will run with the specified source version.

inputs.name: customSourceVersion
inputs.label: Source Version to Use
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the source version to use

inputs.name: useSameBranch
inputs.label: Use same source branch as triggered build
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this option is enabled, the triggered build will be run with the same source branch as the original build. This only makes sense in Git projects and if the triggered build is within the same project and is cause for error if the branch is not available in the triggered build!

inputs.name: branchToUse
inputs.label: Defines Branch that shall be used
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define the branch that shall be used for the triggered build if we don't use the default branch, for example: mySpecialBranch

inputs.name: waitForQueuedBuildsToFinish
inputs.label: Wait till the triggered builds are finished before build continues
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this option is enabled, the script will wait until the all the queued builds are finished. Note: This can take a while depending on your builds and your build will not continue. If you only have one build agent you will even end up in a deadlock situation!

inputs.name: waitForQueuedBuildsToFinishRefreshTime
inputs.label: Time (in seconds) to wait between checks for the build
inputs.helpMarkDown: This value defines how frequent the tasks checks if the triggered builds are completed already. A lower value might have an impact on performance or the network, as the server is queried more often.

inputs.name: failTaskIfBuildsNotSuccessful
inputs.label: Fail the build if the tasks were not successful
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fails this build if one of the triggered tasks was not successful

inputs.name: cancelBuildsIfAnyFails
inputs.label: Cancel all awaited builds if any of them failed
inputs.helpMarkDown: Defines whether the task should attempt to cancel all awaited builds if any of the failed.

inputs.name: treatPartiallySucceededBuildAsSuccessful
inputs.label: Treat a Partially Succeeded Build as Successful
inputs.helpMarkDown: If enabled the task won't fail if the awaited build was partially successful.

inputs.name: downloadBuildArtifacts
inputs.label: Download Build Artifacts
inputs.helpMarkDown: Will download the build artifacts of the triggered builds (if available) as zip and will store it on the build agent for further processing.

inputs.name: dropDirectory
inputs.label: Drop Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Directory where the artifacts should be downloaded to. Variables can be used - e.g. $(agent.workFolder)

inputs.name: storeInEnvironmentVariable
inputs.label: Store triggered build id's in a variable
inputs.helpMarkDown: When enabled, the triggered build id's will be stored in a variable called TriggeredBuildIds that will be available for subsequent Tasks. In case of multiple triggered builds, the values will be separated by ','

inputs.name: demands
inputs.label: Define needed demands.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the demands towards the agent that is used to build. Demands can be comma separated. Just specifying a value will check the demands existance, otherwise you can check for a value by using '='. Example: 'Demand1, Demand2 = Test' would check if there exists the 'Demand1' on the agent and if 'Demand2' equals 'Test'. If no agent can be found that matches the specified demands, the build will fail.

inputs.name: queueid
inputs.label: Define which build queue should be used.
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name or the ID of the queue. This is optional. If not specified, the default queue for the definition will be used.

inputs.name: delayBetweenBuilds
inputs.label: Delay between triggering builds (in seconds)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Defines a delay between the builds that are triggered, if more than one is triggered at the same time. 0 means no delay

inputs.name: buildParameters
inputs.label: Define additional parameters for the build, for example build configuration or platform.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the build parameters. If nothing is specified, the default values will be used. See [Build Task description](https://github.com/huserben/TfsExtensions/blob/master/BuildTasks/overview.md#build-parameters) for more info on the format and the usage of variables.

inputs.name: templateParameters
inputs.label: Define additional template parameters for the build
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the runtime parameters. Check Task Description for more info on the syntax

inputs.name: authenticationMethod
inputs.label: Authentication Method
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select your method of authentication

inputs.name: username
inputs.label: The username that shall be used to authenticate if basic authentication is used

inputs.name: password
inputs.label: The password, Personal Access Token or OAuth Token to authenticate
inputs.helpMarkDown: The password or Personal Access Token. Ideally use a (secret) variable here instead putting it in plaintext. Variables can be referenced with the following syntax: $(myToken). If OAuth Authentication is used, leaving this empty will try to use the System.AccessToken - make sure to enable this build to allow scripts to access the token in the options! Please check out the [documentation](https://github.com/huserben/TfsExtensions/blob/master/BuildTasks/overview.md#authentication-options) in case you have problems.

inputs.name: enableBuildInQueueCondition
inputs.label: Enable Build In Queue Condition
inputs.helpMarkDown: If enabled, build will only be triggered if none of the specified build definitions is currently waiting in a queue.

inputs.name: includeCurrentBuildDefinition
inputs.label: Include current Build Definition as blocking Build
inputs.helpMarkDown: If enabled, current build definition is included in Builds that block trigger of new build.

inputs.name: blockingBuildsList
inputs.label: Blocking Build Definitions
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-Separated list of build definitions that will prevent triggering a new build if they are currently waiting in a queue.

inputs.name: blockInProgressBuilds
inputs.label: Include builds that are currently in progress
inputs.helpMarkDown: If enabled, the condition will check as well for builds that are currently running. Does not apply for current build definition (as this will always be in progress).

inputs.name: dependentOnSuccessfulBuildCondition
inputs.label: Enable Successful Build Dependency Condition
inputs.helpMarkDown: If enabled, build will only be triggered if the last builds of all the specified builds were successful.

inputs.name: dependentBuildsList
inputs.label: Dependent Build Definitions
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-Separated list of build definitions that will prevent triggering a new build if the last builds run were not successful.

inputs.name: dependentOnFailedBuildCondition
inputs.label: Enable Failed Build Dependency Condition
inputs.helpMarkDown: If enabled, build will only be triggered if the last builds of all the specified builds were **not** successful.  Can be used to automatically trigger a build once all the dependent builds are fixed if the last try (e.g. a scheduled build during the night) failed.

inputs.name: dependentFailingBuildsList
inputs.label: Dependent Build Definitions
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-Separated list of build definitions that will prevent triggering a new build if the last builds run were successful.

inputs.name: checkbuildsoncurrentbranch
inputs.label: Only include builds from same branch
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, only builds that are built against the same branch are considered for the conditions. This does not work in TFVC repositories.

inputs.name: failTaskIfConditionsAreNotFulfilled
inputs.label: Fail the Task if any condition is not fulfilled
inputs.helpMarkDown: If enabled, build will fail if a condition is not fulfilled.
